title: Bug 120922: "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs to be improved
description: When editing the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor and then attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating that the changes need to be saved. However, the user is left unsure of what to do next - whether to save or discard the changes. The error message is not clear. The error message is "Source page is dirty." Additionally, the dialog is titled "Error" (including the quotes).
OB: If you edit the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor and then try to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating that you need to save your changes. The problem is that the user needs to figure out how to save the changes (or discard them, which is even more difficult) and the error message is not clear.
EB: A better and more typical approach would be to improve the error message and provide clear instructions on how to save or discard the changes. The dialog should have a more appropriate title and should not contain quotes.
SR:
1. Open the XML Report Designer editor.
2. Switch to the "source" view of the Layout Editor.
3. Make changes to the XML.
4. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view.
5. Observe the error message and the unclear instructions.
6. Note the dialog titled "Error" (including the quotes).
